channel.title: Hyperion + VPS - What'd be the best deal?
channel.description:
I'm now VPS hunting (as a lot of us have done), but found every answer on the 'better VPS' suited for PI's HORRIBLE stability. Now I am asking for Hyperion. What would be the best host, for which plan, and why?
Just a reminder, Hyperion can hold 2,000 [b]bots[/b] (not players), so we cannot base the judgement on that obviously.
What I am thinking to get as of now: [url=http://dotblock.com/]Dotblock[/url] ^ The 1.5 GHz plan.
P.S: Also, when you tell the specs, can you also please say approximately how many players it can hold? Thanks!

item.title: Hyperion + VPS - What'd be the best deal?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Lin:

1GB RAM is pushing it. I remember Jagex said their servers had 512MB RAM and some pretty low processor specs. If Hyperion is as good as it’s claimed to be, you should have absolutely no problem getting one under 512MB RAM and a low-end maybe 1GHz processor.

Lin iirc that server you’re thinking of is the one that hosts the forums. I could be highly mistaken but that is what I have heard. If anything the 3ghz package is the best suited, you will have more room in case any unforeseen problems arise.

Read full topic
item.source: Hyperion + VPS - What'd be the best deal?

item.title: Hyperion + VPS - What'd be the best deal?

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Interesting
I have a hyperion ive been developing for a quite a while now, but never had any idea what to get as a vps

I remember at one point I used myhosting, I cant remember exactly but it might have been a bit more expensive than some other hosters but it was pretty reliable

Lin:

1GB RAM is pushing it. I remember Jagex said their servers had 512MB RAM and some pretty low processor specs. If Hyperion is as good as it’s claimed to be, you should have absolutely no problem getting one under 512MB RAM and a low-end maybe 1GHz processor.
